verses.text: I \add am\add* the rose of Sharon, \add and\add* the lily of the valleys.
As the lily among thorns, so \add is\add* my love among the daughters.
As the apple-tree among the trees of the wood, so \add is\add* my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit \add was\add* sweet to my taste.
He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me \add was\add* love.
Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I \add am\add* sick with love.
His left hand \add is\add* under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.
I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not, nor awake \add my\add* love, till he please.
The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.
My beloved is like a roe, or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, showing himself through the lattice.
My beloved spoke, and said to me, Rise, my love, my fair one, and come away.
For lo, the winter is past, the rain is over \add and\add* gone.
The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing \add of birds\add* is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;
The fig-tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines \add with\add* the tender grape give a \add good\add* smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

O my dove, \add that art\add* in the clefts of the rock, in the secret \add places\add* of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet \add is\add* thy voice, and thy countenance \add is\add* comely.
Take for us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines \add have\add* tender grapes.
My beloved \add is\add* mine, and I \add am\add* his: he feedeth among the lilies.
Until the day shall break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
